item.title: Windows 10 KB5051974 update force installs new Microsoft Outlook app
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the KB5051974 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2, which automatically installs the new Outlook for Windows app and fixes a memory leak bug. [...]

item.title: Microsoft February 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes 4 zero-days, 55 flaws
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Today is Microsoft's February 2025 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 55 flaws, including four zero-day vulnerabilities, with two actively exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: Fortinet warns of new zero-day exploited to hijack firewalls
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Fortinet warned today that attackers are exploiting another now-patched zero-day bug in FortiOS and FortiProxy to hijack Fortinet firewalls and breach enterprise networks. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5051987 & KB5051989 cumulative updates released
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has released Windows 11 KB5051987 and KB5051989 cumulative updates for versions 24H2 and 23H2 to fix security vulnerabilities and issues. [...]

item.title: Russian military hackers deploy malicious Windows activators in Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Sandworm Russian military cyber-espionage group is targeting Windows users in Ukraine with trojanized Microsoft Key Management Service (KMS) activators and fake Windows updates. [...]

item.title: SonicWall firewall exploit lets hackers hijack VPN sessions, patch now
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Security researchers at Bishop Fox have published complete exploitation details for the CVE-2024-53704 vulnerability that allows bypassing the authentication mechanism in certain versions of the SonicOS SSLVPN application. [...]

item.title: US indicts 8Base ransomware operators for Phobos encryption attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Justice Department announced the names of two Phobos ransomware affiliates arrested yesterday in Thailand, charging them on 11 counts due to their involvement in more than a thousand cyberattacks. [...]

item.title: US sanctions LockBit ransomware’s bulletproof hosting provider
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The United States, Australia, and the United Kingdom have sanctioned Zservers, a Russia-based bulletproof hosting (BPH) services provider, for supplying essential attack infrastructure for the LockBit ransomware gang. [...]

item.title: Over 12,000 KerioControl firewalls exposed to exploited RCE flaw
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over twelve thousand GFI KerioControl firewall instances are exposed to a critical remote code execution vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-52875. [...]

item.title: Sky ECC encrypted service distributors arrested in Spain, Netherlands
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Four distributors of the encrypted communications service Sky ECC, used extensively by criminals, were arrested in Spain and the Netherlands. [...]

item.title: Apple fixes zero-day exploited in 'extremely sophisticated' attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Apple has released emergency security updates to patch a zero-day vulnerability that the company says was exploited in targeted and "extremely sophisticated" attacks. [...]

item.title: Hacker pleads guilty to SIM swap attack on US SEC X account
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Today, an Alabama man pleaded guilty to hijacking the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) account on X in a January 2024 SIM swapping attack. [...]

item.title: Police arrests 2 Phobos ransomware suspects, seizes 8Base sites
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A global law enforcement operation targeting the Phobos ransomware gang has led to the arrest of two suspected hackers in Phuket, Thailand, and the seizure of 8Base's dark web sites. The suspects are accused of conducting cyberattacks on over 1,000 victims worldwide. [...]
